messages.subject: Children of God
messages.body:
Received: 	from  

Date:
	Fri, 3 Sep 2004 14:07:51 +0100 (BST)


Dear Madam
 
I am suprised to get your mail in my inbox but your letter warms my heart. I am the manager of the bank here in Warminster On Sea and also heavily involved in the church and local charities. It seems that we may be able to help each other.
 
Yours sincerely
 
Captain Manwairing
Bank of Warminster
High Street
Warminster on Sea
UR2 T1T

messages.subject: DETAILS
messages.body:
X-Originating-IP: 	
Received: 	from  



DEAR PARTNER,
 
I AM WRITING IN FURTHERANCE TO YOUR LETTER WHICH WAS IN REPLY TO MY  CORRESPONDENCE SEEKING YOUR VALUABLE ASSISTANCE IN THE REALISATION OF  THE PROJECT I INDICATED IN MY LETTER TO YOU. THANKS FOR YOUR REPLY. I THANK YOU MOST HEARTILY FOR TAKING INTEREST IN MY PROPOSAL TO YOU.
 
I HAVE THOUGHT OVER IT AND I HAVE ONCE MORE DELIBRATED ON THE
POSSIBILITY OF DOING THIS BUSINESS WITH YOU, I AM EXERCISING GREAT  DISCRETION SO AS NOT TO FALL INTO WRONG HANDS
I WOULD NEED PERSONAL ASSURANCE FROM YOU THAT YOU ARE GOING TO BE FAIR, CO-OPERATIVE, AND STRAIGHT FORWARD WITH ME . WHAT I REALLY NEED IS A TESTED AND COMPETENT ASSOCIATE WHO WOULD HANDLE THE FUND  WHEN IT IS FINALLY PAID TO HIM , I PRAY THAT I FIND SUCH A PERSON
IN YOU. TIME FACTOR COULD NOT ALLOW ME TO HOLD A MEETING WITH YOU. SINCE  I NEEDED THIS FUND TO BE IN YOUR CARE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.
 
IT IS  IMPERATIVE THAT I MENTION TO YOU THAT THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS ARE ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY FOR THE TAKE-OFF OF THIS PROJECT. YOU ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE YOUR PRIVATE MOBILE PHONE AND FAX NUMBERS
 HENCE THE DEPOSIT  .THE FUND DEPOSITED WAS CODED WITH "W205-02"
 
I LOOK FORWARD TO YOUR URGENT REPLY AGAIN , AND FINALY I ASSURE YOU OF MY DESIRE TO HAVE THIS TRANSACTION CONCLUDED WITH YOU.
MEANWHILE LET ME HAVE YOUR PRIVATE PHONE AND FAX NUMBERS 
 
BEST REGARDS
 
MRS ANI

MRS ANI

WHAT I REALLY NEED IS A TESTED AND COMPETENT ASSOCIATE WHO WOULD HANDLE THE FUND WHEN IT IS FINALLY PAID TO HIM , I PRAY THAT I FIND SUCH A PERSON IN YOU. TIME FACTOR COULD NOT ALLOW ME TO HOLD A MEETING WITH YOU. SINCE I NEEDED THIS FUND TO BE IN YOUR CARE AS SOON AS POSSIBLE.

IT IS IMPERATIVE THAT I MENTION TO YOU THAT THE FOLLOWING CONDITIONS ARE ABSOLUTELY NECESSARY FOR THE TAKE-OFF OF THIS PROJECT. YOU ARE REQUIRED TO PROVIDE YOUR PRIVATE MOBILE PHONE AND FAX NUMBERS HENCE THE DEPOSIT .THE FUND DEPOSITED WAS CODED WITH "W205-02"

MRS ANI

messages.subject: Re: DETAILS
messages.body:
Dear Mrs Ani

I hope that you are well.
As a bank manager Im sure you can appreciate my desire
for complete discretion in this matter. My assistant
manager, Mr Wilson is a bit of a busybody and i need
to be assured that your discretion is complete before
I procede any further.

CM

messages.subject: WAITING
messages.body:
Dear Partner,

How are you today and your farmily? I hope they are okay.

I recieved your mail and the contents are well understood. I  am very glad to meet person like you who works with the financial institution and I have believed that you will be able to handle the fund  properly  once the money come to you.

I will implore you to erase fear from your mind and assist me to claim this money so that we can use it for the Glory of God, if your assistant in the Bank is not reliable, please do not involve him into this project.

Please send the details informations I requisted from you so that we can proceed on  the project on monday.

I await your response.

Mrs Ani
messages.raw:
MRS ANI

Date: Sat, 4 Sep 2004 11:33:21 -0700 (PDT)
From: "mrsvictoria ani" <mrsvictoria_ani21@yahoo.com>
Subject: WAITING

Dear Partner,

How are you today and your farmily? I hope they are okay.

I recieved your mail and the contents are well understood. I am very glad to meet person like you who works with the financial institution and I have believed that you will be able to handle the fund properly once the money come to you.

I will implore you to erase fear from your mind and assist me to claim this money so that we can use it for the Glory of God, if your assistant in the Bank is not reliable, please do not involve him into this project.

Please send the details informations I requisted from you so that we can proceed on the project on monday.

I await your response.

Mrs Ani

Im assuming they mean the phone and fax numbers but its never really clear here.....

messages.subject: Re: WAITING
messages.body:
Hello Mrs Ani
 
Appologies for my tardiness in reply. I have been most unwell with some sort of tummy bug. I think I picked up something from the beef I got from Mr Jones the butcher in the village. Apart from that I am fine, thank you so much for asking.
 
I have had a bit of a nightmare and am unable to find the mail you sent me with any instructions on it. Please can you send it again.
 
Thanks so much
 
Kindest regards and warmest feelings
 
Cpt. M.
messages.raw:
CAPTAIN MANWAIRING

Date: Tue, 7 Sep 2004 08:53:17 +0100 (BST)
Subject: Re: WAITING
To: "mrsvictoria ani" <mrsvictoria_ani21@yahoo.com>

Hello Mrs Ani

Appologies for my tardiness in reply. I have been most unwell with some sort of tummy bug. I think I picked up something from the beef I got from Mr Jones the butcher in the village. Apart from that I am fine, thank you so much for asking.

I have had a bit of a nightmare and am unable to find the mail you sent me with any instructions on it. Please can you send it again.

Thanks so much

Kindest regards and warmest feelings

Cpt. M.

messages.body:
Hello Mrs Ani
 
I have just realised what you mean. I am such a dolt sometimes. My wife says that if I didnt have my head screwed on then it wouldnt need a spanner to remove it. I dont know what she means as if it was screwed on the you would need a screw driver and not a spanner but Im assuming thats its a term of endearment.
 
My full name is Captain George Manwairing
My telephone number is +44 870 010 0222
My Fax number is +44 870 010 0223
 
I will also be speaking to my finacial advisor who may be in touch. Do you have a contact with whom he is able to speak?
 
Wishing you all the love of the Lord Jesus
 
Cpt. M

Dear George ,

How are you today and your farmily? I hope they are okay.

I acknowledged the reciept of the detail informations you sent to me yesterday. I have instructed my Attorney to proceed and effect the changes of the documents to reflect your names as the through owner of the fund.

I will implore you to reach my Attoney on email ; jeremy_jide@yahoo.com or contact him on phone 234-80-35987337 and ask him the situation of things because he is in the best position to give you the guildline on the project.

Please contact him immediately and get back to me.

I await your response.

Mrs Ani

And So Rambanjani arrives

messages.body:
Sep 8
Dear Khan,

I recieved your mail and I have been given instructions by Mrs Ani to procure the documents on your behalf.

I was in the Federal High Court to commence the changes of the documents to reflect your partner names as the through owner of the money, once I am through I will contact him and also send the documents to your partner for is perusal.

Please do not hestitate to ask any questions you have in  your mind.

Regards,

Barrister Jeremy
messages.raw:
BARRISTER JEREMY JIDE

Sep 8

Dear Khan,

I recieved your mail and I have been given instructions by Mrs Ani to procure the documents on your behalf.

I was in the Federal High Court to commence the changes of the documents to reflect your partner names as the through owner of the money, once I am through I will contact him and also send the documents to your partner for is perusal.

Please do not hestitate to ask any questions you have in your mind.

Regards,

Barrister Jeremy

messages.body:
Sep 9
Dear Barrister Jide

How are you today? Well I hope. My name is actually Rambanjani. Khan
is my surname so you should address me either as Rambanjani or Dr.
Khan. Just a small point but Im sure that you dont mind me correcting
your English. How would you ever improve your knowledge of our great
language if nobody tells you when you are wrong??

What documents are you dealing with and what should I be looking out
for. As the transfer of ownership to my good friend George, how will
the money be claimed/transfered? Will it be a direct transfer into an
account or will the money be as a bond?

Kindest regards


Rambanjani
messages.raw:
RAMBANJANI KHAN

Sep 9

Dear Barrister Jide

How are you today? Well I hope. My name is actually Rambanjani. Khan is my surname so you should address me either as Rambanjani or Dr. Khan. Just a small point but Im sure that you dont mind me correcting your English. How would you ever improve your knowledge of our great language if nobody tells you when you are wrong??

What documents are you dealing with and what should I be looking out for. As the transfer of ownership to my good friend George, how will the money be claimed/transfered? Will it be a direct transfer into an account or will the money be as a bond?

Kindest regards

Rambanjani

messages.body:
Sep 9
Dear Rambanjani,

I acknowledged the reciept of your mail and the contents are well noted.

The documents need to be changed to your friend names as the through owner of the money and it will be forwarded to the security company in Netherlands where the money is kept before he can claim it.

The Security company will contact him  once they recieve the documents.

Regards,

Barrister Jeremy

Barrister Jeremy

messages.body:
Sep 10
Hello Barrister Jeremy

Sounds great. Do we need to travel to the Netherlands to collect the money?
I dont travel well on planes and my physician (I am a Dr. of science)
says that I have a condition called growbaggia, which tomatos also
have incidently, but it can be helped with a medicine called babybio
apparently.

Anyway, as always lovely to talk to you and George and I look forward
to hearing from the security company soon

Ram

Hello Victoria

How are you today? I hope you are well. Do you have a
picture of you that you could send me. It would be
nice to put a face to you as it seems that I know you
so well.
 I have just been informed by my friend Ram that
everything seems to be going well. so what happens now
my love?

G

messages.subject: Re: clearance/release of consignemnt from Mrs Ani
messages.body:
Dear Mr Williams
 
How fantastic to hear this news. What happens now? I was interupted in my thoughts while deciding how to spend my share of the cash when I was rudely interupted by Mr Jones the butcher shouting "dont panic dont panic" while running about like one of the headless chickens in his shop!!. He is a mentalist that man....
 
Anyway, look forward to hearing from you as soon as you can possibly do so.
 
Kind regards
 
George Manwaring (cpt)
messages.raw:
CAPTAIN MANWAIRING

Date: Mon, 13 Sep 2004 10:00:51 +0100 (BST)

I was interupted in my thoughts while deciding how to spend my share of the cash when I was rudely interupted by Mr Jones the butcher shouting "dont panic dont panic" while running about like one of the headless chickens in his shop!!. He is a mentalist that man....

Anyway, look forward to hearing from you as soon as you can possibly do so.

Kind regards

George Manwaring (cpt)

And then it all went a bit quiet....you will see why

Dear George,

How are you today and your farmily? I hope they are okay.

I just recieved your mail now and I decided to contact you immediately. I have my personal picture but I will  look for somebody that can scan it and send it to you.

Did you recieved the details informations of the Security Company in Netherlands that  I sent to you on Friday, if so you should try and reach them immediately to find out when you should be expecting your money.

I await your response.
Mrs Ani

messages.body:
Hello Victoria
 
Thats such a nice name....I look forward to your mails so much. I have been very alone since my wife left me...sometimes I find that I talk about her as though we are still together. My friend Arthur Daley (who recently sold me a very nice car) says that her indoors is no loss and I should get on but his friend Terry Mccan just wanted to fight a bit.
 
My good and trusted friend Ram has been in touch with your man in the dam and is waiting for a response from him I think. You might like to chivvy him up a bit though as its been a few days and time is of the escence. I am guessing that I will be flying to the netherlands. I did ask this question of your lawer fellow but he never answered. Maybe you could speak to him and find out more about whats going on?
 
Looking forward to the picture
 
Lots of Love
 
GM
messages.raw:
CAPTAIN MANWAIRING

Date: Tue, 14 Sep 2004 10:58:00 +0100 (BST)

Thats such a nice name....I look forward to your mails so much. I have been very alone since my wife left me...sometimes I find that I talk about her as though we are still together. My friend Arthur Daley (who recently sold me a very nice car) says that her indoors is no loss and I should get on but his friend Terry Mccan just wanted to fight a bit.

My good and trusted friend Ram has been in touch with your man in the dam and is waiting for a response from him I think. You might like to chivvy him up a bit though as its been a few days and time is of the escence. I am guessing that I will be flying to the netherlands. I did ask this question of your lawer fellow but he never answered. Maybe you could speak to him and find out more about whats going on?

Looking forward to the picture

Lots of Love

GM

Thanks and remain blessed.

Mrs Ani

messages.body:
CC: 	 mrsvictoria_ani21@yahoo.com
From the desk of Captain George Manwairing
 
Dear Mr Williams/Mr Van Ende
 
I am slightly concerned that I haven't heard from you in a couple of days with everything so close to completion. I am available to come to you and sign documents if thats required. I do hope that it goes smoothly from now on. 2 days is a long time in money!
I have had to copy Victoria in on this so that she can see you are not doing your best for her. She asks me to reply promptly and I have but you are not.
 
Kind regards
 
George

Kind regards

George

We could not reply to you after receiving you first reply to us which sounded very unproffesional and not seriouse after been notified of the arrival of your consignment your reply to our first mail was this .
!How fantastic to hear this news. What happens now? I was interupted in my thoughts while deciding how to spend my share of the cash when I was rudely interupted by Mr Jones the butcher shouting "dont panic dont panic" while running about like one of the headless chickens in his shop!!. He is a mentalist that man...."
 
This sentence we could not understand why you had to reply us this way so please if you can kindly explain we would be glad to forward you with the necessary requirements and procedures.
 
Meanwhile you will be required to come to Amsterdam The netherlands to come and sign the necessary documents that will enable us to make clearance and release of your consignment.
 
You will be notify of the requirements you need to come along with by tomorrow.
 
Expecting to receive your reply.
 
Best regards,
 
Frank van ende
messages.raw:
WILLIAMS ALEX / FRANK VAN ENDE

Date: Wed, 15 Sep 2004 17:31:15 +0800

Dear sir,

We could not reply to you after receiving you first reply to us which sounded very unproffesional and not seriouse after been notified of the arrival of your consignment your reply to our first mail was this . !How fantastic to hear this news. What happens now? I was interupted in my thoughts while deciding how to spend my share of the cash when I was rudely interupted by Mr Jones the butcher shouting "dont panic dont panic" while running about like one of the headless chickens in his shop!!. He is a mentalist that man...."

This sentence we could not understand why you had to reply us this way so please if you can kindly explain we would be glad to forward you with the necessary requirements and procedures.

Meanwhile you will be required to come to Amsterdam The netherlands to come and sign the necessary documents that will enable us to make clearance and release of your consignment.

You will be notify of the requirements you need to come along with by tomorrow.

Expecting to receive your reply.

Best regards,

Frank van ende

At this point I almost p#ssed in my pants with laughter....do they have no sense of humour???

I know with God on ourside we shall complete the project in nick of time. Please always make sure that you disturb the Security Company offen.

Thanks and remain blessed.

Mrs Ani

messages.subject: from ldsta amsterdam clearance/release of funds
messages.body:
LINUX DIPLOMATIC SECURITY TRUST AGENCY
AMSTERDAM THE NETHERLANDS
TEL: 0031 619 050 146
FAX: 0031 619 814 374

FROM THE DESK OF ALEX WILLIAMS

ATTN: Captain George Manwairing 

Dear Sir,

These are the requiremens needed from you to enable us make 
clearance/release of your funds from Mrs Victoria Ani, the following will be 
required from you.

You are required to come to Amsterdam The Netherlands on or before 
Monday the 27th of September 2004 to sign the release document that will 
enable us make clearance/release of your funds to you the beneficiary 
with the following:

1. Your authentic identification e.g Passport or Drivers license

2. Any relevant document related to this transaction e.g certificate of 
deposit or letter of authority

3. Clearing/handeling and administrative charges of euro 5250 and The 
Netherlands Government Tax fee of euro 3150 Total euro 8400 to be paid 
into our account or to be paid cash at the office.

The procedures are as follows, on your arrival in Amsterdam you will be 
picked up by our protocol officer to our office where the signing and 
release of the consignment will take place.

The completion of this transaction will not take more than two working 
days on your arrival here.

You are to send to us your travelling schedule to enable our protocol 
office pick you up from your hotel or Airport and bring you to our 
office.

Contact Mr Alex williams on this telephone number 0031 619 050 146 or 
on the telephone number above or reply to this mail.

Best regards,

Frank van ende
protocol Officer

WILLIAMS ALEX / FRANK VAN ENDE

Subject: from ldsta amsterdam clearance/release of funds

LINUX DIPLOMATIC SECURITY TRUST AGENCY

FROM THE DESK OF ALEX WILLIAMS

You are required to come to Amsterdam The Netherlands on or before Monday the 27th of September 2004 to sign the release document that will enable us make clearance/release of your funds to you the beneficiary with the following:

1. Your authentic identification e.g Passport or Drivers license

2. Any relevant document related to this transaction e.g certificate of deposit or letter of authority

3. Clearing/handeling and administrative charges of euro 5250 and The Netherlands Government Tax fee of euro 3150 Total euro 8400 to be paid into our account or to be paid cash at the office.

The procedures are as follows, on your arrival in Amsterdam you will be picked up by our protocol officer to our office where the signing and release of the consignment will take place.

The completion of this transaction will not take more than two working days on your arrival here.

You are to send to us your travelling schedule to enable our protocol office pick you up from your hotel or Airport and bring you to our office.

Contact Mr Alex williams on this telephone number 0031 619 050 146 or on the telephone number above or reply to this mail.

messages.subject: Re: from ldsta amsterdam clearance/release of funds
messages.body:
Sir
 
Please find enclosed my flight details and look forward to meeting you at the airport. Ive been there once, its quite big I seem to remember so make sure you have a big board and the writing is large as I wear glasses and need to see it from a fair distance away (preferably Black Writing on a white background) so I can see you easily.
 
Economy 	To: AMSTERDAM (AMS) 	Arrive: 21:45 21/09/2004
Flight no: BA8121 	Direct Flight

 
Ill bring cash with me as I assume that is more than acceptable.
 
I look forward to meeting you soon.
 
Kind regards
 
George
messages.raw:
CAPTAIN MANWAIRING

Date: Fri, 17 Sep 2004 16:36:53 +0100 (BST)
Subject: Re: from ldsta amsterdam clearance/release of funds
To: "williams alex"

Please find enclosed my flight details and look forward to meeting you at the airport. Ive been there once, its quite big I seem to remember so make sure you have a big board and the writing is large as I wear glasses and need to see it from a fair distance away (preferably Black Writing on a white background) so I can see you easily.

BRITISH AIRWAYS
From: GATWICK AIRPORT (LGW) Economy To: AMSTERDAM (AMS)
Arrive: 21:45 21/09/2004 Flight no: BA8121
Direct Flight

Ill bring cash with me as I assume that is more than acceptable.

I look forward to meeting you soon.

Kind regards

George

And now its a problem to collect me.. maybe I shouldnt have picked such an unreasonable time.. I was looking forward to finding out they had held up a board with Captain Manwairing on it in big letters!!!

messages.body:
Dear Sir,

We acknowledge the receipt of your travelling schedule, but you arrival time is 21.45 and by this time we are closed so we advsie that you put up in a hotel and call Mr Williams the next morning on this telephone number 0619 050 146 for more directive and also to enable our protocol officer come to pick you up and bring you to our office.

We cant be able to have anybody wait for you at the aiprot by this time so we advise that you take a taxi from the airport to your hotel or before you leave please call Mr Williams to confirm your arrival.

Looking forward to seeing you on Tuesday the 21st Sept .

Best regards,

Frank van ende

messages.subject: please exercise patience

Thanks for your mail, I appreciate your efforts to really want to assist me to complete the transaction.

Please do not go back home since you have made the move to be in Netherlands, if you try his phone and you did not get him, please mail them and tell them how to locate you.

For God sake, please exercise patience and make sure that you contact them and conclude the  project before you go back home.

Thanks and remain blessed.

Mrs Ani

It has never been the money with due respect and we aplogise if we have been rude but we have only been instructing you on the procedures.

You have to understand that we cannot also release this consignment to you if we are not convinced that you are the rightful beneficary. Frank van ende
